chat.content:
I will give you a Coq proof state, including both hypotheses and a specific goal and your need to prove it. Your response should be a singular code block of Coq proof starting with "```coq
", ending with "Qed.```", without any additional explanation or commentary. Follow to these guidelines:
Introduce variables using unique names to avoid any conflicts.
Keep each command distinct and separated, avoid concatenations like ';' or '[cmd|cmd]'.
Organize your proof with bullets like '-', '+', and '*' instead of braces ({, }). Shift to their double symbols like '--' and '++', when necessary.
Effectively use given premises, follow the syntax and structure demonstrated in the examples provided.

Example 1:

Hypotheses:
n, m: nat
IHn: m + n = n + m

Goal:
m + S n = S n + m

Your Response:
```coq
simpl. rewrite <- IHn. auto.
Qed.```

Example 2:
Hypotheses:

Goal:
forall n m : nat, m + n = n + m

Your Response:
```coq
intros n m. induction n.
- simpl. auto.
- simpl. rewrite <- IHn. auto.
Qed.```

Solve This Proof State:

Hypotheses:
p: nat
Hp: p <> 0
z: Z_Zp
y: Z_Zp
x: Z_Zp

Goal:
x ⊕ y = z <-> x = z ⊕ ∸ y

Premises:
Zp_plus_inj_l : forall x y z : Z_Zp, x ⊕ y = x ⊕ z -> y = z
Zp_plus_assoc : forall x y z : Z_Zp, x ⊕ (y ⊕ z) = x ⊕ y ⊕ z
Zp_mult_plus_distr_l : forall x y z : Z_Zp, x ⊗ (y ⊕ z) = x ⊗ y ⊕ x ⊗ z
Zp_mult_plus_distr_r : forall x y z : Z_Zp, (y ⊕ z) ⊗ x = y ⊗ x ⊕ z ⊗ x
Zp_opp_plus : forall x y, ∸ (x ⊕ y) = ∸ x ⊕ ∸ y
Zp_is_ring = {| Radd_0_l := Zp_plus_zero; Radd_comm := Zp_plus_comm; Radd_assoc := Zp_plus_assoc; Rmul_1_l := Zp_mult_one; Rmul_comm := Zp_mult_comm; Rmul_assoc := Zp_mult_assoc; Rdistr_l := fun x y z : Z_Zp => Zp_mult_plus_distr_r z x y; Rsub_def := fun x y => eq_refl; Ropp_def := Zp_minus |} : ring_theory Zp Op Zp_plus Zp_mult (fun x y => x ⊕ ∸ y) ∸ eq
Zp_plus_comm : forall x y, x ⊕ y = y ⊕ x
Zp_minus : forall x, x ⊕ ∸ x = Zp
Zp_invertible_cancel_l : forall x y z : Z_Zp, Zp_invertible x -> x ⊗ y = x ⊗ z -> y = z
Nat.divide = fun x y : nat => exists z : nat, y = z * x : nat -> nat -> Prop Arguments Nat.divide (_ _)%nat_scope
Zp_mult_assoc : forall x y z : Z_Zp, x ⊗ (y ⊗ z) = x ⊗ y ⊗ z
Zp_opp_inj : forall x y, ∸ x = ∸ y -> x = y
Zp_ring_ring_lemma2 : forall (n : nat) (lH : list (Ring_polynom.PExpr Z * Ring_polynom.PExpr Z)) (l : list Z_Zp), Ring_polynom.interp_PElist Zp Op Zp_plus Zp_mult (fun x y => x ⊕ ∸ y) ∸ eq (gen_phiZ Zp Op Zp_plus Zp_mult ∸) id_phi_N (pow_N Op Zp_mult) l lH ->...-> Ring_polynom.PEeval Zp Op Zp_plus Zp_mult (fun x y => x ⊕ ∸ y) ∸ (gen_phiZ Zp Op Zp_plus Zp_mult ∸) id_phi_N (pow_N Op Zp_mult) l pe = Ring_polynom.Pphi_dev Zp Op Zp_plus Zp_mult (fun x y => x ⊕ ∸ y) ∸ 0%Z 1%Z Zeq_bool (gen_phiZ Zp Op Zp_plus Zp_mult ∸) get_signZ l npe
Zp_ring_ring_lemma1 : forall (n : nat) (l : list Z_Zp) (lpe : list (Ring_polynom.PExpr Z * Ring_polynom.PExpr Z)) (pe1 pe2 : Ring_polynom.PExpr Z), Ring_polynom.interp_PElist Zp Op Zp_plus Zp_mult (fun x y => x ⊕ ∸ y) ∸ eq (gen_phiZ Zp Op Zp_plus Zp_mult ∸) id_phi_N (pow_N Op Zp_mult) l lpe -> (let lmp := Ring_polynom.mk_monpol_list 0%Z 1%Z Z.add Z.mul Z.sub Z.opp Zeq_bool Z.quotrem lpe in Ring_polynom.Peq Zeq_bool (Ring_polynom.norm_subst 0%Z 1%Z Z.add Z.mul Z.sub Z.opp Zeq_bool Z.quotrem n lmp pe1) (Ring_polynom.norm_subst 0%Z 1%Z Z.add Z.mul Z.sub Z.opp...
Zp_plus_zero : forall x, Zp ⊕ x = x
Zp_plus_zero_r : forall x, x ⊕ Zp = x
Record monoid_theory (X : Type) (m : X -> X -> X) (u : X) : Prop := mk_monoid { monoid_unit_l : forall x : X, m u x = x; monoid_unit_r : forall x : X, m x u = x; monoid_assoc : forall x y z : X, m x (m y z) = m (m x y) z } Arguments monoid_theory [X]%type_scope _%function_scope Arguments mk_monoid [X]%type_scope _%function_scope _ (_ _ _)%function_scope
mk_monoid : forall (X : Type) (m : X -> X -> X) (u : X), (forall x : X, m u x = x) -> (forall x : X, m x u = x) -> (forall x y z : X, m x (m y z) = m (m x y) z) -> monoid_theory m u
Nat.div_mod : forall x y : nat, y <> 0 -> x = y * (x / y) + x mod y
mk_rt : forall (R : Type) (rO rI : R) (radd rmul rsub : R -> R -> R) (ropp : R -> R) (req : R -> R -> Prop), (forall x : R, req (radd rO x) x) -> (forall x y : R, req (radd x y) (radd y x)) -> (forall x y z : R, req (radd x (radd y z)) (radd (radd x y) z)) -> (forall x : R, req (rmul rI x) x) -> (forall x y : R, req (rmul x y) (rmul y x)) -> (forall x y z : R, req (rmul x (rmul y z)) (rmul (rmul x y) z)) ->...-> ring_theory rO rI radd rmul rsub ropp req
get_signZ = fun z : Z => match z with | Z.neg p => Some (Z.pos p) | _ => None end : Z -> option Z Arguments get_signZ _%Z_scope
Nat.divide_wd = fun (x x' : nat) (Hx : x = x') (y y' : nat) (Hy : y = y') => Morphisms.trans_co_eq_inv_impl_morphism RelationClasses.iff_Transitive (exists p : nat, y = p * x) (exists p : nat, y = p * x') (Morphisms_Prop.ex_iff_morphism (fun p : nat => y = p * x) (fun p : nat => y = p * x') (fun p : nat => Morphisms.per_partial_app_morphism (RelationClasses.Equivalence_PER Nat.eq_equiv) (p * x) (p * x') (Morphisms.Reflexive_partial_app_morphism Nat.mul_wd (Morphisms.reflexive_proper_proxy RelationClasses.Equivalence_Reflexive p) x x' Hx))) (exists p : nat, y' = p * x') (exists p : nat, y' = p * x') (Morphisms.eq_proper_proxy (exists p : nat, y'...
Zp_opp_inv : forall x, ∸ (∸ x) = x
Zp_inj : forall x y, proj1_sig x = proj1_sig y -> x = y
Init.Nat.div = fun x y : nat => match y with | 0 => y | S y' => fst (Init.Nat.divmod x y' 0 y') end : nat -> nat -> nat Arguments Init.Nat.div (_ _)%nat_scope
Record ring_theory (R : Type) (rO rI : R) (radd rmul rsub : R -> R -> R) (ropp : R -> R) (req : R -> R -> Prop) : Prop := mk_rt { Radd_0_l : forall x : R, req (radd rO x) x; Radd_comm : forall x y : R, req (radd x y) (radd y x); Radd_assoc : forall x y z : R, req (radd x (radd y z)) (radd (radd x y) z); Rmul_1_l : forall x : R, req (rmul rI x) x; Rmul_comm : forall x y : R, req (rmul x y) (rmul y x); Rmul_assoc : forall x y z : R, req (rmul x (rmul y z)) (rmul (rmul x y) z); Rdistr_l : forall x y z : R, req (rmul (radd x...
Init.Nat.modulo = fun x y : nat => match y with | 0 => y | S y' => y' - snd (Init.Nat.divmod x y' 0 y') end : nat -> nat -> nat Arguments Init.Nat.modulo (_ _)%nat_scope
Zp_mult_comm : forall x y, x ⊗ y = y ⊗ x
Nat.mul_cancel_r : forall n m p : nat, p <> 0 -> n * p = m * p < -> n = m
Nat.mul_cancel_l : forall n m p : nat, p <> 0 -> p * n = p * m < -> n = m
